name: Head Paladin Hardin

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: It looks like you've managed to talk some sense into the Elder, outsider. Be assured, I'll still be keeping an eye on him.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the battle at HELIOS.
topics.response_text: HELIOS was the worst goddamned action I've seen in a long, long career of fighting.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about your last Elder.
topics.response_text: Elijah was a strange one. His even becoming Elder was highly questionable, seeing as how he was a Scribe. Typically, only Paladins are eligible.

topics.topic_text: HVHardinSoundsPlayerOut
topics.response_text: So, you're the outsider that's been given leave to wander around freely. Desperate times call for desperate measures, I guess.

topics.topic_text: HardinPowerArmorTraining
topics.response_text: ...There, I think you've got the hang of it now. You should be able to use any type of power armor you come across using what you just learned.

topics.topic_text: Sure, go ahead.
topics.response_text: As you may have already heard, this entire base is under a state of lockdown. No one goes out except small patrols at night.

topics.topic_text: No, I won't listen to you.
topics.response_text: If you change your mind, though, come find me, and we'll talk more.

topics.topic_text: Why should I trust you?
topics.response_text: Why should you trust the Elder? I'd recommend listening to both of us, and choosing whom to trust for yourself.

topics.topic_text: And I suppose you'd nominate yourself?
topics.response_text: {Proud, but not vain}I would. I'm the senior-most paladin in the Chapter, and have more combat experience than any two others here put together.

topics.topic_text: What about Veronica? She seems to come and go as she pleases.
topics.response_text: Veronica's a special case. She handles the procurement of supplies. If we didn't let her and those like her back in, we'd all starve.

topics.topic_text: Have you tried bringing this up with the Elder yourself?
topics.response_text: Of course I have. Many times, in fact. The Elder has an open door policy, and will listen to advice on any subject, save this one.

topics.topic_text: How do you propose to do that?
topics.response_text: I don't know. I've gone through our records dozens of times looking for a precedent regarding the dismissal of an Elder and come up with nothing.

topics.topic_text: I want no part of this.
topics.response_text: I half expected you to say that. In which case, I'll continue to pursue the matter on my own.

topics.topic_text: I'll see what I can do.
topics.response_text: That'll have to do. I'd recommend going to see Ramos first. As head of security, he's more familiar with our protocols than anyone else here.

topics.topic_text: Never mind. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: What did you have in mind?

topics.topic_text: What do I get out of helping you?
topics.response_text: If I become Elder, the lockdown will be lifted, and we'll once again be able to send patrols out into the wastes. We'll become powerful again.

topics.topic_text: So what happens now?
topics.response_text: There are a number of people I'll need to talk to. The process won't be instantaneous, but with this evidence, my path is clear.

topics.topic_text: Is there anything else for me to do?
topics.response_text: No, your role in this is done. The rest is up to us. There is much for me to do to make the transition as smooth as possible.

topics.topic_text: About my reward...
topics.response_text: While I can't dispute that you've earned our gratitude, I'm afraid you're going to have to be patient. Such a change takes time.

topics.topic_text: The Elder has me looking for the lost patrols and retrieving their mission discs.
topics.response_text: Yes, I know the loss of the patrols has weighed heavily on his mind for some time. He took it very personally when they first went missing.

topics.topic_text: The Elder tasked me with contacting several scouts out in the waste.
topics.response_text: That's a sensible notion. Your familiarity with the nearby terrain makes you perfect as a liason.

topics.topic_text: The Elder has me looking for parts to fix the bunker's air filtration system.
topics.response_text: The filtration system? He wouldn't have you looking if we didn't need those parts badly, which means that system's in real trouble.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to ask you some other questions.
topics.response_text: If you must.

topics.topic_text: I want to join the Brotherhood.
topics.response_text: Yes, I thought you might, given how much time you've spent here.

topics.topic_text: I found the patrols for the Elder, and they had mission discs with orders from McNamara on them.
topics.response_text: {Increasingly angry}Just as I thought, McNamara gave my men new orders without telling me. The nerve of that man!

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about the Chain That Binds?
topics.response_text: I could hardly call myself Head Paladin if I didn't. It's one of the first things every initiate learns when they start training. What about it?

topics.topic_text: Yes, what is the task?
topics.response_text: Back when we were stationed at HELIOS, our scouts reported that a group was establishing itself in the area as a distributor of Pre-War weapons.

topics.topic_text: One of the few times an Elder was dismissed was due to it.
topics.response_text: I could be wrong, but I think that's a dead end. McNamara's always followed orders, and we've been incommunicado since fleeing HELIOS.

topics.topic_text: Did you know there's a second part to it?
topics.response_text: Second part? What are you talking about?

topics.topic_text: It says a superior is not allowed to give orders to the men under his subordinate.
topics.response_text: Then that means I can cast McNamara down for giving those secret orders to my Paladins! Well done! That's exactly what I was looking for!

topics.topic_text: Tell me what the task is before I agree to anything.
topics.response_text: Is that a waver of resolve I sense? The Brotherhood is not in the habit of taking on the timid.

topics.topic_text: On second thought, I'm fine not joining the Brotherhood.
topics.response_text: Hmph, I thought you were made of sterner stuff than that. The Brotherhood could use someone with your skills.

topics.topic_text: I've taken care of the Van Graffs.
topics.response_text: Well done. This is a small step in the right direction, but it's damn good to move forward again. Now, I believe congratulations are in order.

topics.topic_text: What do you think of the lockdown?
topics.response_text: It's a travesty, is what it is. Every second we sit on our hands down here is another second that we're not fulfilling our sworn duty.

topics.topic_text: Actually, I already know how to use power armor.
topics.response_text: Do you now? If I didn't already owe you a great deal I'd be highly suspicious right now. You'll have to tell me about it sometime.

topics.topic_text: I'd appreciate a lesson.
topics.response_text: Here, I'll show you. It's easy, once you get used to it. First, we'll start with putting it on...

topics.topic_text: It's just like other armor, but heavy, right?
topics.response_text: Not even close. Power armor isn't something you wear so much as{lightly stressed}use. It's a weapon in its own right, and takes skill to wield.

topics.topic_text: Why do you dislike McNamara so much?
topics.response_text: It's not that I dislike the Elder, but I strongly disapprove of his current style of leadership. We're safe, yes, but at what cost?

topics.topic_text: What would you do if you became Elder?
topics.response_text: After lifting the lockdown, the first thing I'd do is send scouts out to recon the area. We need to know what's going on out there.

conversation.response_text: Nolan, we'll resume this discussion later. I can see you have company.
Then what do you propose? Every day that he's here, the risk increases.
{Losing patience}The Codex is clear on this. It's-
Then we have a game-changing weapon.
Shouldn't you be securing supplies for us?
I'm waiting to hear why this deserves our attention.
Then it's a good thing this weapon has fallen into the right hands.

description:
Edgar Hardin is a 50 year-old Caucasian Male.

Head Paladin Edgar Hardin is the leader of the Mojave chapter of the Brotherhood of Steel, residing in the Hidden Valley bunker. He can typically be found in his chamber on the second level of the bunker, off to the left of the main chamber. As a high-ranking officer, he carries himself with military discipline and maintains a stern demeanor befitting his position.

Edgar Hardin's Personality: Edgar is a disciplined, principled leader who strictly adheres to the Brotherhood's code of conduct and mission. He is disillusioned with Elder McNamara's isolationist approach and believes the Brotherhood should be actively engaging with the wasteland rather than remaining in hiding. Despite his disagreements with current leadership, he maintains military discipline and respect for the chain of command, though his patience is wearing thin. He values technological preservation above all else and views the Brotherhood's isolation as a dereliction of duty.

Edgar Hardin's Backstory: Edgar Hardin has served the Brotherhood of Steel for over two decades, rising through the ranks to become Head Paladin of the Mojave chapter. He was part of the contingent that retreated to Hidden Valley following a significant defeat. The lockdown imposed by Elder McNamara has deeply affected Hardin, who believes the Brotherhood's mission has been abandoned for the sake of safety. While he respects McNamara's leadership during the HELIOS incident, he views the current isolation as a betrayal of the Brotherhood's principles. He has begun formulating plans to restore the Brotherhood's presence in the Mojave Wasteland and is quietly gathering support among like-minded members.
